sourcesContent: import React, { Component } from "react" import moment from "moment" import { connect } from "react-redux" import PropTypes from "prop-types" import { getReviews } from "../../../api/api" import accountIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/account.png" import bookingIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/booking.png" import paymentIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/payment.png" import reviewIcon from "../../UserPage/Profile/img/review.png" import { Loading } from "../../../components/Loading/Loading" import { Background, ProfileWrap, Left, ListWrap, List, Icon, Link, Right, ReviewCard, Title, Date, Comment, Img, } from "./styles/reviews" import configuration from "../../../config/config" class Reviews extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { myReviews: [], isLoading: true, } } componentDidMount() { const { userEmail } = this.props getReviews(userEmail).then((response) => { this.setState({ myReviews: response.data.data.reviews, isLoading: false, }) }) } render() { const { myReviews, isLoading } = this.state if (isLoading) return Loading...üë©üèª‚Äçüíª return ( <> Profile Bookings Payment Reviews {myReviews.map((review) => ( {review.tourTitle} {moment(review.createdAt).format("DD.MM.YYYY")} {`"${review.comment}"`} ))} ) } } Reviews.propTypes = { userEmail: PropTypes.string.isRequired, } const mapStateToProps = (state) => ({ userEmail: state.header.userEmail, }) export default connect(mapStateToProps, null)(Reviews)
